spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall layout roughly matches (3 bedrooms positioned left/right with central living-dining and kitchen/utility cluster), but there is a major deviation at the bottom-left where the 2D plan’s Home Office/Maid’s Room + lobby area is not represented correctly. Several openings (doors/windows) do not clearly correspond to the 2D plan, and exterior openings/railings are not consistently placed as shown.

structural_fidelity.notes: Core adjacency is mostly preserved (Living/Dining adjacent to Kitchen; Bedroom-2 near Toilet-2; Bedroom-1 near Toilet-1), but a critical program element (Home Office/Maid’s Room) appears missing/changed and replaced by an exterior balcony-like volume. This also introduces an extra exterior mass that is not present in the 2D plan. Wall/door modeling is generally clean, but fidelity to the plan’s partitioning at the entry/lobby zone is poor.

furniture_mapping.notes: Living/dining and bedroom furniture broadly aligns with the intended room functions, but the missing/altered Home Office/Maid’s Room prevents correct furniture mapping there. Some furniture scaling/spacing appears approximate rather than plan-accurate.

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric view is coherent and readable, with generally clean geometry and decent lighting. Minor issues: openings/windows are not clearly defined to match the plan, and some elements (railings/exterior edges) look simplified, reducing architectural clarity.

detected_errors.description: Home Office / Maid’s Room (bottom-left in 2D plan) is not correctly represented in the 3D render (appears missing or replaced).
Hallucinated exterior balcony/terrace-like volume at the bottom-left of the 3D render that does not exist in the 2D plan.
Entry/lobby zone partitioning and openings do not match the 2D plan layout; the bottom-left circulation/room boundary configuration is misplaced.
Window/opening placements on exterior walls are not consistently mapped to the 2D plan (openings appear simplified and do not clearly align with indicated window positions).
Several door orientations/placements (notably around the modified bottom-left area and some interior transitions) do not clearly match the 2D plan’s swing/position intent.
Local proportion distortion around the entry/lobby/bottom-left block due to the substituted balcony mass, altering the footprint compared to the 2D plan.
